title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: John Scott to R. M. Manly, May 17, 1869
summary: Scott reports on the end of the school year in Staunton, and writes about the unlikely prospects that the black community will be able to afford to construct a school house due to lack of funds. Scott inquires about the prospect of receiving government assistance.
keywords: Aid/Relief, Education, Property, Women, American Civil War
